subject: Development of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways-reg.
text: HRTy vel <TTAf xfetarrut 7Mt Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (ss 4ar- a {THNf @lcT4) #48/ Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 9T National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vft-5 Q 6, Raer-10, ERqT, T fcrit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector- Dwarka; Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Development of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways/2020 No.18.50/2020 dated 20th August, 2020 [As per approval given by Chairman on File No. NHAI/BMWSA/2020/9302] NHAI has acquired land parcels near existing Brownfield National Highways and proposed Greenfield access-controlled expressways for development of Wayside Amenities and has undertaken bidding of land parcels on various Brownfield NHs in the past: As per the extant guidelines issued by the Ministry vide letter No. RWINH- 34032/4/91-DO IIl dated 3rd April 1998,the reserve price for appointing the lessees for operation of the wayside amenities o various NHs has been fixed 10% (fixed proportion) of the cost of land. 2_ In the past bids invited by the NHAI for development of wayside amenities based on the guidelines issued by the Ministry were not very encouraging due to the reason of higher capital investment and difficulty in forecast of footfall & revenue generation: 3_ A stakeholder meeting has been held in NHAI HQ wherein comments were received  from the various industry players engaged in the operation of wayside amenities on NHs as well as other transportation sector facilities. Based on the inputs received from the stake-holders , a draft policy for working out the business strategy for the operation of the wayside amenities on the brownfield as well Greenfield NHIExpressway corridors being developed by NHAI has been approved by the Board of NHAI in its 148th meeting held on 07.07.2020. 4 Business strategy and Model Concession Agreement for the operation of the wayside amenities as approved by the Board of NHAI is detailed as under: A Method of awardldevelopment of site Land parcels on Brownfield National Highways with area of land parcel less than 2 Ha: i) Land shall be given to the private partyl developer on lease basis ii) The period of lease shall be 30 years for sites with no constructed asset, i.e; in cases where the Wayside Amenity will have to be developed by the private partyl developer iii) The period of lease shall be 15 years for sites where Authority has already undertaken construction of Wayside Amenity iv) The private partyl  developer shall pay an annual lease rent to the Authority during lease period Page 1 of' 8 RT MT 4 NHAI 10, New
